title: Measuring Distances in the Universe
content: Over its ten-year survey, Rubin Observatory will detect about 20 billion galaxies, most of them very faint because of their large distances away from Earth. To calculate the distance to these very faint galaxies, the Rubin Observatory LSST Camera measures their brightness through different filters. These values are then compared to models of galaxy brightness at various distances. The distance of the best matching model is used for the observed galaxy.
